instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery is not charging.
threads.message:
MacBook only started up on power supply. I replaced the batteries. Now MacBook sees battery  but won't charge it (0.7A)  - I checked on different batteries. Sometimes it downloads 2A for a while but then drops. The power adapter is original. I did a smc reset. Two usb-c ports have 20v  

with power supply and battery  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 13.06v
only battery  10.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery is not charging.
threads.message:
Any of tested batteries was good for sure?

Check <TRANSISTOR>Q6950</TRANSISTOR> and its related components and traces.
Also check diode mode and voltage on SCL/SDA lines, before and after <TRANSISTOR>Q6950</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery is not charging.
threads.message:
The battery is definitely working - I charged it with another macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>.  I even did GSX tests - battery is ok.
There is an error on the repaired device - "battery - combined battery test".
<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> - 0v  diode  0.57
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_3V3_BATT_SCL</SIGNAL> - jumps 2.9v TO 3.3v, diode the same before and after <TRANSISTOR>Q6950</TRANSISTOR> - 0.96
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_3V3_BATT_SDA</SIGNAL> - jumps 2.9v TO 3.3v,  diode the same before and after <TRANSISTOR>Q6950</TRANSISTOR>  - 0.98
<SIGNAL>PPBAT_G3H_CHGR_R</SIGNAL> with power supply - 13v    
<SIGNAL>PPBAT_G3H_CHGR_R</SIGNAL> battery only -  10v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery is not charging.
threads.message:
Check ohm resistance over <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>/23.
Does the machine start with charged battery (without charger connected)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery is not charging.
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> 3.6 m ohm
<CAPACITOR>C7021</CAPACITOR> 68 k ohm
<CAPACITOR>C7072</CAPACITOR> 65k ohm
<CAPACITOR>C7023</CAPACITOR> 65k ohm
Starts normally on a charged battery alone.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery is not charging.
threads.message:
I meant to measure ohm scale between the pins of mentioned caps.
Check schematic, you must get 2 ohm on each one!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery is not charging.
threads.message:
I don't have this result anywhere. Can you explain with some exact example. I'm not sure if i am doing it right.

<CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> between pin 1 and 2 - 3.3 ohm
<CAPACITOR>C7023</CAPACITOR> between pin 1 and 2 - 2.2 ohm

Sometimes there is a moment that for a while it charges correctly immediately after connecting, but it lasts a while.
In the meantime, I replaced the ISL and still the same symptom.
Today even got the same model of a working Macbook and I replaced the motherboard - the same symptom.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery is not charging.
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>/23 readings look good.

Did you test the board on other shell and still not charging?
I'm not sure which board in which shell you've tested.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery is not charging.
threads.message:
I tested every option. Each time the motherboard was the reason for the lack of battery charging.
I tested the board in another working shell and the same thing happened

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery is not charging.
threads.message: I'm already running out of ideas.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery is not charging.
threads.message:
How the problem appeared?

Do SMC reset.
Also try DFU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery is not charging.
threads.message:
Suddenly, it stopped charging and worked under the power supply alone. 
I reset smc, DFU to - restore. I have the same working motherboard so I can check something else.  Do you have any idea master ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery is not charging.
threads.message:
Compare voltage and diode mode readings around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7065</TRANSISTOR>/70 with good board.
Check <SIGNAL>CHGR_A</SIGNAL>/BMON w/ and w/o battery connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery is not charging.
threads.message: In diode mode everything looked the same. I replaced the <TRANSISTOR>Q7065</TRANSISTOR> and the MacBook started to charging. <SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL> with battery and power supply was around 12v all the time. Should I still replace the <TRANSISTOR>Q7070</TRANSISTOR> ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery is not charging.
threads.message: If charges now, don't change anything more.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery is not charging.
